comments.text:
Hello,
Firefox 3.0.1.
A page triggered a popup window, so the yellow bar appeared.
I want to see the page, so I click on the "Options" button. This shows a sort of local menu.
A button giving a local menu is weird user interface. The kind of broken UI you typically see on software coming from Windows.
A button does something or brings a dialog, but must not spawn a local menu out of no hook. Usually, local menus are hooked at some place and they have a kind of arrow, so the user knows s/he see a menu which s/he can click.
Let's get rid of the "Options" button and make it a true, nice-looking, local menu.
Nicolas

comments.raw_text:
I do not think that it would be an improvement. A button without ellipsis means an action will occur at click. A button with ellipsis means a dialog will appear at click, allowing for an action to occur. Both are wrong here.

The button has to be replaced with a normal local menu, with a triangle.
